intro: Aleuritia vialii, commonly known as the Chinese snowbell, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern China. It belongs to the Hydrangeaceae family and is characterized by its white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters and features opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. Aleuritia vialii thrives in partial shade to full sun and prefers moist, well-drained soil. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in garden settings.
